intro: Ionopsis minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf ionopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It grows as a low-growing herb with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ionopsis minutiflora is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often blooming after rainfall.
